meanings.definition: To shed tears, typically as an expression of distress or pain.
meanings.sent1: She would weep when she felt sad.
meanings.sent2: The child began to weep after losing her favorite toy.
meanings.sent3: The puppy would weep whenever it was bath time.
meanings.sent4: The willow tree seemed to weep in the gentle rain.
meanings.sent5: Her eyes would weep silently in the darkness of night.

meanings.definition: To express grief or sorrow audibly.
meanings.sent1: He would weep loudly at the funeral.
meanings.sent2: The old man would weep softly as he remembered his lost love.
meanings.sent3: The cat would weep dramatically when it wanted attention.
meanings.sent4: The violin seemed to weep a melancholy tune.
meanings.sent5: The wind made the branches weep in the storm.
